verses.verse: Now<WG1161> a certain<WG5100> man was<WG2258> sick<WG770>, named Lazarus<WG2976>, of<WG575> Bethany<WG963><WG1537>, the town<WG2968> of Mary<WG3137> and<WG2532> her<WG846> sister<WG79> Martha<WG3136>.

<WG1161>(It was<WG2258> that Mary<WG3137> which<WG3588> anointed<WG218> the Lord<WG2962> with ointment<WG3464>, and<WG2532> wiped<WG1591> his<WG846> feet<WG4228> with her<WG846> hair<WG2359>, whose<WG3739> brother<WG80> Lazarus<WG2976> was sick<WG770>.)
Therefore<WG3767> his sisters<WG79> sent<WG649> unto<WG4314> him<WG846>, saying<WG3004>, Lord<WG2962>, behold<WG2396>, he whom<WG3739> thou lovest<WG5368> is sick<WG770>.

When<WG1161> Jesus<WG2424> heard<WG191> that, he said<WG2036>, This <WG3778> sickness <WG769> is <WG2076> not <WG3756> unto <WG4314> death <WG2288> , but <WG235> for <WG5228> the glory <WG1391> of God <WG2316> , that <WG2443> the Son <WG5207> of God <WG2316> might be glorified <WG1392> thereby <WG1223><WG846> .
Now<WG1161> Jesus<WG2424> loved<WG25> Martha<WG3136>, and<WG2532> her<WG846> sister<WG79>, and<WG2532> Lazarus<WG2976>.

When<WG5613> he had heard<WG191> therefore<WG3767> that<WG3754> he was sick<WG770>, he abode<WG3306> two<WG1417> days<WG2250> still<WG5119><WG3303> in<WG1722> the same place<WG5117> where<WG3739> he was<WG2258>.
Then<WG1899> after<WG3326> that<WG5124> saith he<WG3004> to his disciples<WG3101>, Let us go <WG71> into <WG1519> Judaea <WG2449> again <WG3825> .

His disciples<WG3101> say<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, Master<WG4461>, the Jews<WG2453> of late<WG3568> sought<WG2212> to stone<WG3034> thee<WG4571>; and<WG2532> goest thou<WG5217> thither<WG1563> again<WG3825>?

Jesus<WG2424> answered<WG611>, Are there <WG1526> not <WG3780> twelve <WG1427> hours <WG5610> in the day <WG2250> ? If <WG1437> any man <WG5100> walk <WG4043> in <WG1722> the day <WG2250> , he stumbleth <WG4350> not <WG3756> , because <WG3754> he seeth <WG991> the light <WG5457> of this <WG5127> world <WG2889> .
But <WG1161> if <WG1437> a man <WG5100> walk <WG4043> in <WG1722> the night <WG3571> , he stumbleth <WG4350> , because <WG3754> there is <WG2076> no <WG3756> light <WG5457> in <WG1722> him <WG846> .

These things<WG5023> said<WG2036> he<WG846>: and<WG2532> after<WG3326> that<WG5124> he saith<WG3004> unto them<WG846>, Our <WG2257> friend <WG5384> Lazarus <WG2976> sleepeth <WG2837> ; but <WG235> I go <WG4198> , that <WG2443> I may awake <WG1852> him <WG846> out of sleep <WG1852> .
Then<WG3767> said<WG2036> his<WG846> disciples<WG3101>, Lord<WG2962>, if<WG1487> he sleep<WG2837>, he shall do well<WG4982>.

Howbeit<WG1161> Jesus<WG2424> spake<WG2046> of<WG4012> his<WG846> death<WG2288>: but<WG1161> they<WG1565> thought<WG1380> that<WG3754> he had spoken<WG3004> of<WG4012> taking of rest<WG2838> in sleep<WG5258>.
Then<WG5119><WG3767> said<WG2036> Jesus<WG2424> unto them<WG846> plainly<WG3954>, Lazarus <WG2976> is dead <WG599> .

And <WG2532> I am glad <WG5463> for <WG1223> your sakes <WG5209> that <WG3754> I was <WG2252><WG2258> not <WG3756> there <WG1563> , to the intent <WG2443> ye may believe <WG4100> ; nevertheless <WG235> let us go <WG71> unto <WG4314> him <WG846> .

Then<WG3767> said<WG2036> Thomas<WG2381>, which<WG3588> is called<WG3004> Didymus<WG1324>, unto his fellowdisciples<WG4827>, Let us<WG71> also<WG2532> go<WG71>, that<WG2443> we<WG2249> may die<WG599> with<WG3326> him<WG846>.
Then<WG3767> when Jesus<WG2424> came<WG2064>, he found<WG2147> that he<WG846> had<WG2192> lain in<WG1722> the grave<WG3419> four<WG5064> days<WG2250> already<WG2235>.
Now<WG1161> Bethany<WG963> was<WG2258> nigh<WG1451> unto Jerusalem<WG2414>, about<WG5613> fifteen<WG1178> furlongs<WG4712> off<WG575>:

And<WG2532> many<WG4183> of<WG1537> the Jews<WG2453> came<WG2064> to<WG4314> Martha<WG3136> and<WG2532> Mary<WG3137><WG4012>, to<WG2443> comfort<WG3888> them<WG846> concerning<WG4012> their<WG846> brother<WG80>.

Then<WG3767> Martha<WG3136>, as soon as<WG5613> she heard<WG191> that<WG3754> Jesus<WG2424> was coming<WG2064>, went and met<WG5221> him<WG846>: but<WG1161> Mary<WG3137> sat<WG2516> still in<WG1722> the house<WG3624>.

Then<WG3767> said<WG2036> Martha<WG3136> unto<WG4314> Jesus<WG2424>, Lord<WG2962>, if<WG1487> thou hadst been<WG2258> here<WG5602>, my<WG3450> brother<WG80><WG302> had<WG2348> not<WG3756> died<WG2348>.
But<WG235> I know<WG1492>, that even<WG2532> now<WG3568>, whatsoever<WG3754><WG3745><WG302> thou wilt ask<WG154> of God<WG2316>, God<WG2316> will give<WG1325> it thee<WG4671>.
Jesus<WG2424> saith<WG3004> unto her<WG846>, Thy <WG4675> brother <WG80> shall rise again <WG450> .
Martha<WG3136> saith<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, I know<WG1492> that<WG3754> he shall rise again<WG450> in<WG1722> the resurrection<WG386> at<WG1722> the last<WG2078> day<WG2250>.

Jesus<WG2424> said<WG2036> unto her<WG846>, I <WG1473> am <WG1510> the resurrection <WG386> , and <WG2532> the life <WG2222> : he that believeth <WG4100> in <WG1519> me <WG1691> , though <WG2579> he were dead <WG599> , yet shall he live <WG2198> :

And <WG2532> whosoever <WG3956> liveth <WG2198> and <WG2532> believeth <WG4100> in <WG1519> me <WG1691> shall <WG599> never <WG3364><WG1519><WG165> die <WG599> . Believest thou <WG4100> this <WG5124> ?

She saith<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, Yea<WG3483>, Lord<WG2962>: I<WG1473> believe<WG4100> that<WG3754> thou<WG4771> art<WG1488> the Christ<WG5547>, the Son<WG5207> of God<WG2316>, which<WG3588> should come<WG2064> into<WG1519> the world<WG2889>.

And<WG2532> when she had<WG2036> so<WG5023> said<WG2036>, she went her way<WG565>, and<WG2532> called<WG5455> Mary<WG3137> her<WG846> sister<WG79> secretly<WG2977>, saying<WG2036>, The Master<WG1320> is come<WG3918>, and<WG2532> calleth for<WG5455> thee<WG4571>.
As soon as<WG5613> she<WG1565> heard<WG191> that, she arose<WG1453> quickly<WG5035>, and<WG2532> came<WG2064> unto<WG4314> him<WG846>.

Now<WG1161> Jesus<WG2424> was<WG2064> not yet<WG3768> come<WG2064> into<WG1519> the town<WG2968>, but<WG235> was<WG2258> in<WG1722> that place<WG5117> where<WG3699> Martha<WG3136> met<WG5221> him<WG846>.

The Jews<WG2453> then<WG3767> which<WG3588> were<WG5607> with<WG3326> her<WG846> in<WG1722> the house<WG3614>, and<WG2532> comforted<WG3888> her<WG846>, when they saw<WG1492> Mary<WG3137>, that<WG3754> she rose up<WG450> hastily<WG5030> and<WG2532> went out<WG1831>, followed<WG190> her<WG846>, saying<WG3004><WG3754>, She goeth<WG5217> unto<WG1519> the grave<WG3419> to<WG2443> weep<WG2799> there<WG1563>.

Then<WG3767> when<WG5613> Mary<WG3137> was come<WG2064> where<WG3699> Jesus<WG2424> was<WG2258>, and saw<WG1492> him<WG846>, she fell down<WG4098> at<WG1519> his<WG846> feet<WG4228>, saying<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, Lord<WG2962>, if<WG1487> thou hadst been<WG2258> here<WG5602>, my<WG3450> brother<WG80> had<WG302> not<WG3756> died<WG599>.

When<WG5613> Jesus<WG2424> therefore<WG3767> saw<WG1492> her<WG846> weeping<WG2799>, and<WG2532> the Jews<WG2453> also weeping<WG2799> which came<WG4905> with her<WG846>, he groaned<WG1690> in the spirit<WG4151>, and<WG2532> was troubled<WG5015><WG1438>,
And<WG2532> said<WG2036>, Where <WG4226> have ye laid <WG5087> him <WG846> ? They said<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, Lord<WG2962>, come<WG2064> and<WG2532> see<WG1492>.
Jesus<WG2424> wept<WG1145>.
Then<WG3767> said<WG3004> the Jews<WG2453>, Behold<WG2396> how<WG4459> he loved<WG5368> him<WG846>!

And<WG1161> some<WG5100> of<WG1537> them<WG846> said<WG2036>, Could<WG1410> not<WG3756> this man<WG3778>, which<WG3588> opened<WG455> the eyes<WG3788> of the blind<WG5185>, have caused<WG4160> that<WG2443> even<WG2532> this man<WG3778> should<WG599> not<WG3361> have died<WG599>?

Jesus<WG2424> therefore<WG3767> again<WG3825> groaning<WG1690> in<WG1722> himself<WG1438> cometh<WG2064> to<WG1519> the grave<WG3419><WG1161>. It was<WG2258> a cave<WG4693>, and<WG2532> a stone<WG3037> lay<WG1945> upon<WG1909> it<WG846>.

Jesus<WG2424> said<WG3004>, Take ye away <WG142> the stone <WG3037> . Martha<WG3136>, the sister<WG79> of him that was dead<WG2348>, saith<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, Lord<WG2962>, by this time<WG2235> he stinketh<WG3605>: for<WG1063> he hath been<WG2076> dead four days<WG5066>.

Jesus<WG2424> saith<WG3004> unto her<WG846>, Said I <WG2036> not <WG3756> unto thee <WG4671> , that <WG3754> , if <WG1437> thou wouldest believe <WG4100> , thou shouldest see <WG3700> the glory <WG1391> of God <WG2316> ?

Then<WG3767> they took away<WG142> the stone<WG3037> from the place where<WG3757> the dead<WG2348> was<WG2258> laid<WG2749>. And<WG1161> Jesus<WG2424> lifted<WG142> up<WG507> his eyes<WG3788>, and<WG2532> said<WG2036>, Father <WG3962> , I thank <WG2168> thee <WG4671> that <WG3754> thou hast heard <WG191> me <WG3450> .

And <WG1161> I <WG1473> knew <WG1492> that <WG3754> thou hearest <WG191> me <WG3450> always <WG3842> : but <WG235> because <WG1223> of the people <WG3793> which <WG3588> stand by <WG4026> I said <WG2036> it , that <WG2443> they may believe <WG4100> that <WG3754> thou <WG4771> hast sent <WG649> me <WG3165> .
And<WG2532> when he thus<WG5023> had spoken<WG2036>, he cried<WG2905> with a loud<WG3173> voice<WG5456>, Lazarus <WG2976> , come <WG1204> forth <WG1854> .

And<WG2532> he that was dead<WG2348> came forth<WG1831>, bound<WG1210> hand<WG5495> and<WG2532> foot<WG4228> with graveclothes<WG2750>: and<WG2532> his<WG846> face<WG3799> was bound about<WG4019> with a napkin<WG4676>. Jesus<WG2424> saith<WG3004> unto them<WG846>, Loose <WG3089> him <WG846> , and <WG2532> let him <WG863> go <WG5217> .

Then<WG3767> many<WG4183> of<WG1537> the Jews<WG2453> which<WG3588> came<WG2064> to<WG4314> Mary<WG3137>, and<WG2532> had seen<WG2300> the things which<WG3739> Jesus<WG2424> did<WG4160>, believed<WG4100> on<WG1519> him<WG846>.
But<WG1161> some<WG5100> of<WG1537> them<WG846> went their ways<WG565> to<WG4314> the Pharisees<WG5330>, and<WG2532> told<WG2036> them<WG846> what things<WG3739> Jesus<WG2424> had done<WG4160>.

¶ Then<WG3767> gathered<WG4863> the chief priests<WG749> and<WG2532> the Pharisees<WG5330> a council<WG4892>, and<WG2532> said<WG3004>, What<WG5101> do we<WG4160>? for<WG3754> this<WG3778> man<WG444> doeth<WG4160> many<WG4183> miracles<WG4592>.

If<WG1437> we let<WG863> him<WG846> thus<WG3779> alone<WG863>, all<WG3956> men will believe<WG4100> on<WG1519> him<WG846>: and<WG2532> the Romans<WG4514> shall come<WG2064> and<WG2532> take away<WG142> both<WG2532> our<WG2257> place<WG5117> and<WG2532> nation<WG1484>.

And<WG1161> one<WG1520><WG5100> of<WG1537> them<WG846>, named Caiaphas<WG2533>, being<WG5607> the high priest<WG749> that same<WG1565> year<WG1763>, said<WG2036> unto them<WG846>, Ye<WG5210> know<WG1492> nothing at all<WG3756><WG3762>,

Nor<WG3761> consider<WG1260> that<WG3754> it is expedient<WG4851> for us<WG2254>, that<WG2443> one<WG1520> man<WG444> should die<WG599> for<WG5228> the people<WG2992>, and<WG2532> that the whole<WG3650> nation<WG1484> perish<WG622> not<WG3361>.

And<WG1161> this<WG5124> spake he<WG2036> not<WG3756> of<WG575> himself<WG1438>: but<WG235> being<WG5607> high priest<WG749> that<WG1565> year<WG1763>, he prophesied<WG4395> that<WG3754> Jesus<WG2424> should<WG3195> die<WG599> for that<WG5228> nation<WG1484>;

And<WG2532> not<WG3756> for that<WG5228> nation<WG1484> only<WG3440>, but<WG235> that<WG2443> also<WG2532> he should gather together<WG4863> in<WG1519> one<WG1520> the children<WG5043> of God<WG2316> that were scattered abroad<WG1287>.
Then<WG3767> from<WG575> that<WG1565> day<WG2250> forth they took counsel together<WG4823> for to<WG2443> put<WG615> him<WG846> to death<WG615>.

Jesus<WG2424> therefore<WG3767> walked<WG4043> no more<WG3765> openly<WG3954> among<WG1722> the Jews<WG2453>; but<WG235> went<WG565> thence<WG1564> unto<WG1519> a country<WG5561> near<WG1451> to the wilderness<WG2048>, into<WG1519> a city<WG4172> called<WG3004> Ephraim<WG2187>, and there<WG2546> continued<WG1304> with<WG3326> his<WG846> disciples<WG3101>.

¶ And<WG1161> the Jews'<WG2453> passover<WG3957> was<WG2258> nigh at hand<WG1451>: and<WG2532> many<WG4183> went<WG305> out of<WG1537> the country<WG5561> up<WG1519> to Jerusalem<WG2414> before<WG4253> the passover<WG3957>, to<WG2443> purify<WG48> themselves<WG1438>.

Then<WG3767> sought they for<WG2212> Jesus<WG2424>, and<WG2532> spake<WG3004> among<WG3326> themselves<WG240>, as they stood<WG2476> in<WG1722> the temple<WG2411>, What<WG5101> think<WG1380> ye<WG5213>, that<WG3754> he will<WG2064> not<WG3364> come<WG2064> to<WG1519> the feast<WG1859>?

Now<WG1161> both<WG2532> the chief priests<WG749> and<WG2532> the Pharisees<WG5330> had given<WG1325> a commandment<WG1785>, that<WG2443>, if<WG1437> any man<WG5100> knew<WG1097> where<WG4226> he were<WG2076>, he should shew<WG3377> it, that<WG3704> they might take<WG4084> him<WG846>.
